president of the Server and Tools Division which has grown into a$ 15 billion business on his watch, was unceremoniously deposed when Steve Ballmer notified employees by email that he will leave in June. The CEO wants to rectify Microsoft's misfires in mobile phones and tablet computers, as well as ensure that the company doesn't fall behind in cloud software, the news report said. But across technology circles the move by Google Inc. -- founded during the first dot-com boom-- to replace CEO Eric Schmidt with the 38-year-old Page left some wondering how the search giant would deal with middle age. Founder becoming CEO... Is this like a Steve Jobs returning or a Jerry Yang returning? Chris Dixon, a technology veteran who has invested in Skype and Foursquare, tweeted.
